forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 46. Northwest wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 63, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. North wind 2 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.

weather_report:
As the early hours of Monday embrace Downtown San Francisco, a gentle blanket of clouds hints at the fleeting warmth of daylight yet to come. With temperatures lingering around the mid-forties, a soft northwest wind whispers through the streets, inviting a cozy wrap against its chill. The morning will gradually yield to an awakening of soft sunlight. By midday, the clouds will part to reveal a gentle interplay of sun and shade, while a pleasing breeze rustles through the neighborhoods, rising a few degrees to the low sixties—ideal for a light layer or perhaps a classic denim jacket.

In this delicate weather tapestry, the city’s hills echo with the remnants of the marine layer, a subtle reminder of the San Francisco fog's presence, now softened and retreating. Along the skyline, the Golden Gate Bridge will emerge charmingly, while opportunities abound for simple yet delightful pursuits. Perhaps a stroll along the Embarcadero, where the water shimmers and the city buzzes softly, or a visit to a local café where the aroma of fresh brew mingles with the outside air. Enjoying thoughtfully prepared meals at lunchtime in the local gastropubs will also elevate this pleasantly mild day, encouraging you to relish every moment life offers—woven into the fabric of this iconic city.
